Key Match Events: Emmanuel Clase rebounded by retiring Aaron Judge on a flyout, blowing a 100.6 mph fastball by Giancarlo Stanton for a swinging strikeout and retiring Oswaldo Cabrera on a groundout after Jazz Chisholm’s two-out single.
Pre-Game Insights: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt expressed his unwavering support for Emmanuel Clase, saying 'Emmanuel will be right back out there in the ninth tonight. Because he's our guy.'
Post-Match Reflections: Vogt said, 'He responded the way I thought he would. This is the best closer on the planet. I'll stand by that.'

Vogt also said, 'You want to take him back out there, but he had thrown 60 pitches over the last three days. Had we won tonight, we had two more games to go, and you can’t overextend these guys and have them throw 75 or 80 pitches in three days. That’s not right.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland's bullpen paced this deep playoff run by combining to throw 53 2/3 innings with a 3.52 ERA, while starting pitchers combined for 33 2/3 innings and a 3.82 ERA.
The fatigue, however, was evident as October went on; six of the seven homers allowed by Cleveland’s bullpen this postseason came in the ALCS.
Others: Guardians rode their dominant bullpen led by 'The Big Four' – Cade Smith, Tim Herrin, Hunter Gaddis, and Clase -- that ended the regular season with the fourth-best bullpen ERA (2.57) of any team since 1995 until the wheels fell off.
